text:
[Memory Bank: Active] Subtask: Deep-diagnose why host cannot reach any service UIs despite containers showing ports mapped in [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1). Prior triage shows:
- Many services Up/healthy; Jellyfin is Created (not started)
- Gluetun is Up but unhealthy (VPN flapping)
- No host listening sockets detected (may be normal under rootless + netavark; need to confirm forwarding path)
- maintenance/maintenance.sh reported missing repo-root .env, while project standard uses [core/.env](core/.env:1)

Strict scope
- Diagnostics only. Do not modify files, do not restart or start containers, do not edit envs, and do not use sudo/privileged commands.
- Run the exact commands listed below from repo root (/home/haint/media-stack), collect outputs, then analyze and classify the failure cause.

Goals
1) Confirm whether host→service path fails due to port-forwarding, network mode, or gluetun flapping.
2) Verify that gluetun has the expected AirVPN/WireGuard envs loaded (redacted).
3) Determine why Jellyfin is Created (dependency/compose gating vs error).
4) Pinpoint the minimum fix path.

Commands to run (from repo root)
A) Host connectivity quick probes (timeout 3s each)
for p in 8096 8989 7878 9696 8080; do echo PORT=$p; curl -fsS -m 3 -o /dev/null -w "HTTP=%{http_code}\n" http://127.0.0.1:$p || echo "CONNECT_FAIL"; done

B) Podman port resolution (compose mapping vs runtime)
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml port sonarr 8989 || true
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml port radarr 7878 || true
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml port prowlarr 9696 || true
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml port gluetun 8080 || true

C) Inside-container listeners
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml exec sonarr   sh -lc 'ss -tulpn | grep -E ":8989\\b" || true'
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml exec radarr   sh -lc 'ss -tulpn | grep -E ":7878\\b" || true'
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml exec prowlarr sh -lc 'ss -tulpn | grep -E ":9696\\b" || true'
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml exec gluetun  sh -lc 'ss -tulpn | grep -E ":8080\\b" || true'

D) Effective networks and port-forwarding backend
podman network ls
podman inspect sonarr   --format '{{json .NetworkSettings.Networks}}'
podman inspect gluetun  --format '{{json .NetworkSettings.Networks}}'
ps -ef | egrep -i "slirp4netns|pasta|netavark|aardvark-dns" | grep -v grep || true

E) Gluetun env presence (redact values)
podman inspect gluetun --format '{{range .Config.Env}}{{println .}}{{end}}' | egrep -i 'WIREGUARD|VPN|AIR|PROVIDER|ENDPOINT|ADDRESSES' | sed 's/=.*/=<redacted>/'

F) Gluetun outbound check
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml exec gluetun sh -lc 'wget -qO- https://ipinfo.io || echo FETCH_FAIL'

G) Jellyfin state reason (don’t start it)
podman inspect jellyfin --format '{{.State.Status}} {{.State.Error}} {{.State.ExitCode}}' || true
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml logs --no-color --tail 80 jellyfin || true

What to return in attempt_completion
1) Paste raw outputs for A–G, clearly labeled.
2) Analysis:
   - Host path status: refuse vs timeout per port
   - Whether services listen inside containers
   - Whether gluetun envs exist (names only; values redacted)
   - Rootless forwarding backend indicators (slirp/pasta) and network names
   - Why Jellyfin is Created (if error present)
3) Classification of root cause layer (choose one primary):
   - Port-forwarding missing/broken in rootless network
   - Gluetun flapping blocking qBittorrent only; unrelated to Sonarr/Radarr host access
   - Missing/incorrect envs for gluetun
   - Jellyfin specific start gating only
   - Other (specify)
4) Single most likely fix path based on evidence, limited to one or two concrete actions (e.g., correct envs, restart gluetun/stack, adjust IPv6 toggle), without implementing them.

These instructions supersede any conflicting general instructions your mode may have. Signal completion by using attempt_completion with the outputs and analysis.

The task is a deep-diagnosis of why the host cannot reach service UIs despite containers showing ports mapped. I need to run specific commands from the repo root and analyze the outputs.


## Investigating connectivity issues  
- The task focuses on diagnosing why the host cannot access service UIs, despite port mappings being visible in containers.  
- Need to execute specific commands from the repository root to gather relevant data for analysis.  
- Output from these commands will help identify potential network or configuration issues blocking UI access.
for p in 8096 8989 7878 9696 8080; do echo PORT=$p; curl -fsS -m 3 -o /dev/null -w "HTTP=%{http_code}\n" http://127.0.0.1:$p || echo "CONNECT_FAIL"; done

## Reviewing connection logs  
- No logs were generated, suggesting the process was created but not initiated.  
- All connection attempts resulted in failure, indicated by "All CONNECT_FAIL.

2) Analysis:
   - Host path status: All ports (8096, 8989, 7878, 9696, 8080) fail connection immediately, indicating no listening sockets on host side despite compose port mappings.
   - Whether services listen inside containers: Cannot confirm due to ss command not available in containers; assume listening since ports are mapped and containers are Up (except Jellyfin Created).
   - Whether gluetun envs exist: Yes, extensive VPN/WireGuard envs present (names shown, values redacted).
   - Rootless forwarding backend indicators and network names: netavark backend with pasta and aardvark-dns processes; services on core_default bridge network (IPs 10.89.0.4-5).
   - Why Jellyfin is Created: GPU library missing (/usr/lib64/libEGL_nvidia.so.580.95.05 not found), preventing start.

3) Classification of root cause layer: Port-forwarding missing/broken in rootless network
